channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Parental Alienation Awareness Day
item.description:
Sunday, 12 October 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red to support Parental Alienation Awareness Day

Parental Alienation Awareness Day raises awareness of the impact of parental alienating behaviours, trauma, and coercive control on children and families. By lighting up monuments in red and displaying our banners, we aim to draw public attention to these often-overlooked forms of abuse, encouraging a broader understanding of how these behaviours harm children’s mental and emotional well-being. The Day seeks to educate the community, reduce stigma, and advocate for better support and services for families affected by trauma, coerced attachment, and alienation. Ultimately, our goal is to promote healthier, more supportive environments where children can maintain loving relationships with both parents and their extended family, free from manipulation and coercion.

This Light Up is organised by: Eeny Meeny Miney Mo Foundation

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Spain National Day
item.description:
Sunday, 12 October 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Red and Yellow to support Spain National Day

The National Day of Spain, or Fiesta Nacional, is held annually on the 12th of October and celebrates the culture and contribution Spain and its people have made to the world in its long history, and the Spanish community here in Brisbane.

This Light Up is organised by: The Spanish and Australian Social-Cultural Association

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Helena's House
item.description:
Monday, 13 October 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Teal and Gold to support Helena's House

Helena McIlwain passed away on the 13th of October 2019 from a pulmonary embolism. Helena worked in disabilities while studying biomedical science at QUT. Her dream was to to be in the medical world so she could help and support people with a disability. A house will be named in her honour. Helena's House. A unique space where our young people will practice independent living skills and develop the emotional resilience needed to gradually transition from the family home to a life of their choice, with people they know. Helena’s House will support our children’s essential next step on their path to a more independent life – one that is safe, secure and guaranteed.

This Light Up is organised by: BestLife Inc

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Wave of Light - Infant Loss Remembrance
item.description:
Wednesday, 15 October 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue Pink and White to support Wave of Light - Infant Loss Remembrance

The Perinatal Loss Team at the Mater Mothers Hospital in Brisbane, are privileged to witness the beginnings of new life every day. But alongside this joy, we also walk with families who have faced the profound sadness of pregnancy or infant loss. Our mission is to create a compassionate and supportive space where families can honour and remember the babies, they have lost through pregnancy loss or early infancy.
On 15 October, we come together for our annual Wave of Light Ceremony. This ceremony offers a gentle, reflective environment for grieving families to come together, share in remembrance, and find solace in community. This Wave of Light Ceremony is a heartfelt gathering to honour, remember, and stand beside those who have experienced the loss of a baby in the past year. As we light candles in their memory, we become part of a global tribute - a wave of light that shines with love, remembrance, and hope. By lighting up the bridge blue and pink will create a further wave of light and recognition to the families experiencing this loss.

This Light Up is organised by: Mater Mothers' Hospital Brisbane

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Sexual Assault Awareness with WWYW
item.description:
Thursday, 16 October 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Orange to support Sexual Assault Awareness with WWYW

What Were You Wearing Australia (WWYW) is a registered charity working to end sexual violence and support survivors. We exist to challenge victim-blaming, break the stigma around sexual assault, and advocate for cultural and systemic change. Our work includes public education, survivor advocacy, community campaigns, and direct support initiatives.
Our name reclaims the question so often asked of survivors “What were you wearing” and serves as a bold reminder that clothing is never an invitation for assault. We aim to shift blame off survivors and onto the culture that protects perpetrators and silences truth, raising awareness about sexual assault and challenge the harmful myth that clothing causes violence.
This activation, led by What Were You Wearing Australia, honours survivors and brings visibility to the reality that 1 in 3 Australian women will experience sexual violence. Lighting the Story Bridge in orange, alongside a symbolic clothing display, serves as a powerful reminder that no outfit ever asks for it. We’re lighting up the city to support survivors, start conversations, and say enough.

This Light Up is organised by: WWYW Australia

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

What Were You Wearing Australia (WWYW) is a registered charity working to end sexual violence and support survivors. We exist to challenge victim-blaming, break the stigma around sexual assault, and advocate for cultural and systemic change. Our work includes public education, survivor advocacy, community campaigns, and direct support initiatives.
Our name reclaims the question so often asked of survivors “What were you wearing” and serves as a bold reminder that clothing is never an invitation for assault. We aim to shift blame off survivors and onto the culture that protects perpetrators and silences truth, raising awareness about sexual assault and challenge the harmful myth that clothing causes violence.
This activation, led by What Were You Wearing Australia, honours survivors and brings visibility to the reality that 1 in 3 Australian women will experience sexual violence. Lighting the Story Bridge in orange, alongside a symbolic clothing display, serves as a powerful reminder that no outfit ever asks for it. We’re lighting up the city to support survivors, start conversations, and say enough.

This Light Up is organised by: WWYW Australia

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Developmental Language Disorder Awareness Day
item.description:
Friday, 17 October 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Developmental Language Disorder Awareness Day

The DLD Project Foundation is committed to improving the lives of the 1 in 14 Australians with Developmental Language Disorder (DLD), a lifelong, hidden disability that affects the ability to understand and use language. Despite its prevalence, DLD remains one of the most under-recognised neurodevelopmental conditions in Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: The DLD Project Foundation

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Sharing is Caring
item.description:
Saturday, 18 October 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Pink to support Sharing is Caring

Sharing is Caring. More foster carers are needed across the Brisbane area and this week we are hoping to inspire more people to think about if they could share their home, life and safety with a child by becoming a foster carer.
Life Without Barriers is a not for profit social purpose organisation that actively recruits foster carers to provide support to vulnerable children in Brisbane who require a safe place to stay while their families work on safety.

This Light Up is organised by: Life Without Barriers

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: War Widows Day
item.description:
Sunday, 19 October 2025

City Hall will be lit Blue and White to support War Widows Day

The annual War Widows Day, officially acknowledged by the Queensland Government in 2022, aims to increase awareness about the array of resources and support accessible to war widows and widowers. Additionally, it stands as a poignant reminder of the profound loss experienced by the families and friends of those who have served Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian War Widows Queensland

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Light It Red for Dyslexia Awareness
item.description:
Monday, 20 October 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support Light It Red for Dyslexia Awareness

Light it Red for Dyslexia Awareness is a volunteer initiative by Code REaD Dyslexia Network, a national registered charity, to light significant monuments, buildings and landmarks across
Australia in RED for Dyslexia Awareness.
Our vision remains clear: creating a world where people impacted by dyslexia are acknowledged through early identification, understanding and inclusion; supported with evidence-based teaching and access to assistive technology and accommodations; and empowered with access to opportunity.

This Light Up is organised by: Code ReAd

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Children's Week 2025
item.description:
Tuesday, 21 October 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Teal to support Children's Week 2025

Children’s Week is an annual event celebrated in Australia. A diverse range of events and activities are organised at National, State and Local levels to celebrate the rights of children to enjoy childhood and for the wider community to rejoice in their talents, skills and abilities. To learn more visit: childrensrightsqld.org.au

item.title: International Stuttering Awareness Day
item.description:
Wednesday, 22 October 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Sea Green to support International Stuttering Awareness Day

International Stuttering Awareness Day is to raise awareness about stuttering which affects 1% to 5% of the population, equating to 25k to 125k in Brisbane and 250k to 1.25M within Australia. STUTTA, trading as the Australian Stuttering Association, exists to encourage and empower people who stutter to embrace their individual journeys. Our vision is a world in which people who stutter are given the space, time, and opportunity to speak.

This Light Up is organised by: STUTTA

item.title: MELT Festival
item.description:
Thursday, 23 October 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Rainbow to celebrate MELT Festival

Melt is an open access festival of Queer art and culture premiering in Brisbane/Magandjin, running from 22 October to 9 November 2025. It builds on the success of its predecessor Melt, the LGBTQIA+ festival staged annually at Brisbane Powerhouse since 2015. In a city gearing up to host the Olympic and Paralympic Games in 2032, Melt is a showcase of queer art, artists, allies, icons, sports and ideas.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Powerhouse

item.title: Diwali - Festival of Lights
item.description:
Friday, 24 October 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit White, Orange and Green to celebrate Diwali - Festival of Lights

The Federation of Indian Communities of Queensland (FICQ) invites you to Diwali Festival of Lights, King George Square Friday 24 October 2025.
Diwali is a joyous celebration observed across India, symbolizing the triumph of good over evil. Traditionally, people showcase their creativity by fashioning vibrant rangolis with colours or flowers, adorning the streets with lights, lighting diyas, using eco-friendly firecrackers, and sharing gifts, sweets, and savoury treats. This festival serves as a unifying and uplifting experience for communities throughout India.

This Light Up is organised by: Federation of Indian Communities of Qld

Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: All Night Long Marathon Walk
item.description:
Saturday, 25 October 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support All Night Long Marathon Walk

Walk together, all night long, for sick kids and their families. All Night Long is a brand-new all-night walking marathon, in support of Ronald McDonald House Charities South-East Queensland and Children's Hospital Foundation. Participants will walk 42km through Brisbane's most iconic scenery, raising funds for Queensland's sickest kids and their families.

item.title: World Polio Day
item.description:
Monday, 27 October 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Polio Awreness Month

October is Polio Awareness Month with World Polio Day recognised on October 24. There are ongoing efforts to eradicate polio, much progress has been made but we are concerned that some Australians are still living with long term effects of polio. Our aim is to strive to make people aware of this preventable disease.

This Light Up is organised by: Rotary Club of New Farm

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: 2025 International Mastocytosis and Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, 28 October 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support 2025 International Mastocytosis and Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day

The International Mastocytosis & Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day aims to spread the word about a family of diseases that range from moderately disruptive to life-threatening forms. This annual awareness day is the result of a collaborative decision made by 24 mast cell disease advocacy groups, with the first Day commemorated in 2018. It represents the one day in the year to direct attention to these rare diseases. A day that will bring mast cell organisations together to highlight the impact of the diseases in patients’ lives and the importance of research and education in the acceptance of diversity. It aims to raise awareness and understanding of the need for more accurate diagnostics, better treatments, and further investments in research. A day that will lift up the hopes of mast cell patients all over the world in dreaming of a brighter future. The #SpotOurSpots campaign is the Australia and Aotearoa New Zealand initiative for the Awareness Day.

This Light Up is organised by: The Australasian Mastocytosis Society

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Eve of Bandanna Day
item.description:
Wednesday, 29 October 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue and Green to support the Eve of Bandanna Day

Bandanna Day is the flagship fundraising and awareness campaign for Canteen. Since Bandanna Day began it has raised more than $35 million to support young people impacted by cancer.
On 30 October, we ask participants to buy a bandanna and wear it in solidarity with over 23,000 young people who are impacted by cancer every year.

This Light Up is organised by: Canteen

item.title: Eve of World Teachers Day
item.description:
Thursday, 30 October 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple, Blue and Green to celebrate the Eve of World Teachers Day

World Teachers' Day is a significant, unique, wonderful & highly appreciated way of promoting the importance of the teaching profession & helps to celebrate the important work of teachers. Quality teaching of our current & future generations is vital to Brisbane's, and our state's, future. Teachers have often felt under-appreciated in the past, and this light-up very successfully helps to recognise, celebrate and promote this crucial profession.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Education

item.title: Day for Daniel
item.description:
Friday, 31 October 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Red to support Day for Daniel

Now in its 21st year, Day for Daniel, to be held on Friday 31 October 2025, endeavours to raise awareness of child safety, protection, and harm prevention. Day for Daniel is Australia’s largest child safety education and awareness day. The Daniel Morcombe Foundation was established in 2005 by Bruce and Denise Morcombe. The Foundation is driven by a vision of a world where children and young people are safe, supported, and equipped with the tools to navigate their world confidently and securely.

This Light Up is organised by: Daniel Morcombe Foundation

Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

Now in its 21st year, Day for Daniel, to be held on Friday 31 October 2025, endeavours to raise awareness of child safety, protection, and harm prevention. Day for Daniel is Australia’s largest child safety education and awareness day. The Daniel Morcombe Foundation was established in 2005 by Bruce and Denise Morcombe. The Foundation is driven by a vision of a world where children and young people are safe, supported, and equipped with the tools to navigate their world confidently and securely.

This Light Up is organised by: Daniel Morcombe Foundation

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
